column4: i fI install pacakges with apt-get, and then I do apt-get upgrade, will it only add bug fixes or will it upgrade to the latest version of the pacakge?
so I would need to manually upgrade to a new version?
chaddy is wrong apt-get upgrade will upgrade your packages to the newest version form the repos. and newest version = security update
so using firefox as an example - would apt-get upgrade take me from FF4 to FF5?
in 11.04 yes bit that is a special case
or for django, from django 1.0 to django 1.3?
with other programs you only get the security update
as i said, backports are for that case
so what's the difference between update and upgrade?
apt-get update will update the sources-list, apt-get upgrade will upgrade the packages, apt-get dist-upgrade will also upgrade dependecies
okay, so if I just want security updates, but I don't want to upgrade the version of the package, then I use apt-get update?
you use this to get the latest security updates for all packages "sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade"
won't dist-upgrade upgrade me from version a to version b?
see man apt-get for the difference betwenn update, upgrade and dist-upgrade or see what i wrote above :)
